pullRequest.title: DB-8893 Time travel at session level

commit.message: DB-8893 Time travel at session level

nodes.bodyText:
We could catch NumberFormatException rather than the all catching Exception
Also, rename parseIntE to parseLongE
You don't test for positive long here, only long. If you wanna test positive, add an if after the try_catch. Or change the error message

Is it even possible to combine !read_only with a snapshot timestamp? Shouldn't we throw something then?
What about line 523 of this file where we call !isReadOnly, should we also check against SNAPSHOT_TIMESTAMP?
What about SYSSTATEMENTSRowFactory.java:301?
If a check could be applied to all those, I'd push the session check inside isReadOnlyUpgrade(llc)

This "snapshot" kinda looks like a magic value here.
Since both "olapQueue" and "snapshot" are magic'ed in GenericLanguageConnectionContext, why not define constants there and use it here?
Although, does that even work? I'd think that sessionProperties are set in GenericLanguageConnectionContext with enums already and that "snapshot" would only be available in the connectionProperties

                <arg>configurationField</arg>
            </msg>
 
+

nodes.bodyText:
Should we throw an exception?
In any case, this XXX should either be addressed or removed. We might wanna replace the whole thing with assert cm != null
Should that include the timestamp of our time travel?
Debug tracing message may be confusing. Either change it or refactor code to avoid copying code.
